summary.para: Gets the most recent Control Panel view: Classic view or Category view.

param.name: pView
param.para: A pointer that receives the most recent view. Valid values are as follows:
0x0. Windows 7 and later. Equivalent to CPVIEW_CLASSIC.
0x1. Windows 7 and later. Equivalent to CPVIEW_CATEGORY.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the path of a specified Control Panel item.

param.name: pszName
param.para: A pointer to the item's canonical name or its GUID. This value can be NULL. See Remarks for further details. For a complete list of Control Panel item canonical names, see Canonical Names of Control Panel Items.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: When this method returns, contains the path of the specified Control Panel item as a Unicode string.

param.name: cchPath
param.para: The size of the buffer pointed to by pszPath, in WCHARs.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Opens the specified Control Panel item, optionally to a specific page.

param.name: pszName
param.para: A pointer to the item's canonical name as a Unicode string. This parameter is optional and can be NULL. If the calling application passes NULL, then the Control Panel itself opens. For a complete list of Control Panel item canonical names, see Canonical Names of Control Panel Items.

param.name: pszPage
param.para: A pointer to the name of the page within the item to display. This string is appended to the end of the path for Shell folder Control Panel items or appended as a command-line parameter for Control Panel (.cpl) file items. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the first page is shown.

param.name: punkSite
param.para: A pointer to the site for navigating in-frame for Shell folder Control Panel items. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that retrieve the view state of the Control Panel, the path of individual Control Panel items, and that open either the Control Panel itself or an individual Control Panel item.
